Module opentdk.api
Package org.opentdk.api.io

Class FileUtil

java.lang.Object
org.opentdk.api.io.FileUtil
public class FileUtil
extends Object
Class with static methods to perform several I/O operations like reading files, creating files or checking files.
Author:
LK Test Solutions

    • checkDir

      public static boolean checkDir​(String inDir) throws IOException
      Checks the existence of a directory and returns true (directory exists) or false (directory doesn't exist).
      Parameters:
      inDir - String with the directory name and its full or relative path.
      Returns:
      true the defined directory exists; false the defined directory doesn't exist.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurred.

    • checkDir

      public static boolean checkDir​(File inDir) throws IOException
      Checks the existence of a directory and returns true (directory exists) or false (directory doesn't exist).
      Parameters:
      inDir - Object of type File of the directory that needs to be checked.
      Returns:
      true the defined directory exists; false the defined directory doesn't exist.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurred.
      See Also:
      File

    • checkDir

      public static boolean checkDir​(String inDir, boolean createFolders) throws IOException
      Checks for the existence of a defined path on the file system and creates all folders that don't exist.
      Parameters:
      inDir - String with the directory name and its full or relative path.
      createFolders - true = create missing folder and all its parents; false = don't create missing folders.
      Returns:
      true the defined directory exists; false the defined directory doesn't exist.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurred.

    • checkDir

      public static boolean checkDir​(File inDir, boolean createFolders) throws IOException
      Checks for the existence of a defined path on the file system and creates all folders that don't exist.
      Parameters:
      inDir - Object of type File of the directory that needs to be checked.
      createFolders - true = create missing folder and all its parents; false = don't create missing folders.
      Returns:
      true the defined directory exists; false the defined directory doesn't exist.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurred.
      See Also:
      File

    • checkFile

      public static boolean checkFile​(String fileName)
      Checks the existence of a file and returns true (file exists) or false (file doesn't exist).
      Parameters:
      fileName - Name of the file including its full or relative path
      Returns:
      true = file exists; false = file doesn't exist
      See Also:
      File.exists()

    • createFile

      public static boolean createFile​(String fileName) throws IOException
      Creates a new empty file only if a file with this name does not yet exist. The method will return false in case that parent directories with in the files path are missing, or the file already exists.
      Parameters:
      fileName - Name including the full or relative path of the file that needs to be created.
      Returns:
      true if the named file does not exist and was successfully created; false if the named file already exists.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurred.
      See Also:
      File.createNewFile()

    • createFile

      public static boolean createFile​(String fileName, boolean createParentDir) throws IOException
      Creates a new empty file only if a file with this name does not yet exist. With the createParentDir argument it can be chosen, if missing parent directories in the path will automatically be created or not.
      Parameters:
      fileName - Name including the full or relative path of the file that needs to be created
      createParentDir - true create missing parent directories; false don't create missing parent directories.
      Returns:
      true if the named file does not exist and was successfully created; false if the named file already exists.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurred.
      See Also:
      File.createNewFile()

    • createFile

      public static boolean createFile​(File file) throws IOException
      Creates a new empty file only if a file with this name does not yet exist. The method will return false in case that parent directories with in the files path are missing, or the file already exists.
      Parameters:
      file - Object of type File with the file that needs to be created.
      Returns:
      true if the named file does not exist and was successfully created; false if the named file already exists.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurred.
      See Also:
      File.createNewFile()

    • createFile

      public static boolean createFile​(File file, boolean createParentDir) throws IOException
      Creates a new empty file only if a file with this name does not already exist. With the createParentDir argument missing parent directories in the path will automatically be created or not.
      Parameters:
      file - Object of type File with the file that needs to be created
      createParentDir - true create missing parent directories; false don't create missing parent directories.
      Returns:
      true if the named file does not exist and was successfully created; false if the named file already exists.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurred.
      See Also:
      File.createNewFile()

    • copyFile

      public static long copyFile​(String sourceFile, String targetFile) throws IOException
      Creates a copy of the input source file to the chosen target file.
      Parameters:
      sourceFile - Full source file name (path + name) that should be copied.
      targetFile - Full target file name (path + name) for the copy operation.
      Returns:
      the number of bytes transferred.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurred.

    • deleteFile

      public static boolean deleteFile​(String fileName) throws IOException
      Deletes the input file if it does exist.
      Parameters:
      fileName - Full name (path + name) of the file to remove.
      Returns:
      true if the file was deleted by this method; false if the file could not be deleted because it did not exist.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurred.

    • renameFile

      public static void renameFile​(String oldFile, String newFile) throws SecurityException, FileNotFoundException, IOException
      Rename a file when the full names are available. If the file to rename already exists, it gets replaced.
      Parameters:
      oldFile - The full name of the current file.
      newFile - The full name of the file that should be the replacement of the old file.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - If one of the files does not exist.
      SecurityException - If the file/directory creation failed in the current context.
      IOException - If any I/O error occurs on the file system.

    • renameFile

      public static void renameFile​(File oldFile, File newFile) throws SecurityException, FileNotFoundException, IOException
      Rename a file when the file objects are available. If the file to rename already exists, it gets replaced. File.renameTo() is not recommended to use while it returns false with no exception when something went wrong. The cause is hard to analyze.
      Parameters:
      oldFile - The full name of the current file.
      newFile - The full name of the file that should be the replacement of the old file.
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - If one of the files does not exist.
      SecurityException - If the file/directory creation failed in the current context.
      IOException - If any I/O error occurs on the file system.

      Parameters:
      path - The path of the file (path + name) or folder that should be deleted as string.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurred.

    • deleteFileOrFolder

      public static void deleteFileOrFolder​(Path path) throws IOException
      Delete a file or folder.
      Parameters:
      path - The path of the file (path + name) or folder that should be deleted.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurred.

    • isTextFile

      public static boolean isTextFile​(String fullName) throws IOException
      Checks if the committed file instance is a text file. In general every file is of type binary and is composed of bytes. The way it gets interpreted by a program makes it possible to group the file type. The most common group are text files that represent reasonable text and can be opened by any text editor program.
      The first step in this check routine is to check if the file is readable. Afterwards the guess methods of URLConnection get used to determine the file type. If this is not successful the file extension will be compared with a set of most common text file endings. If none of the listed extension hits the first lines of the file get checked character by character. If the characters are all below 0x7F (which is the common range of valid ASCCI characters for text files), the file gets treated as text. Afterwards a binary check gets passed to include a negative check as well and avoid mistakes. If all these operations fail, an IOException gets thrown.
      Parameters:
      fullName - full path and name of the file to check.
      Returns:
      true: file is of type text, false: otherwise.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the filed type could not be determined.

    • isTextFile

      public static boolean isTextFile​(File file) throws IOException
      Checks if the committed file instance is a text file. In general every file is of type binary and is composed of bytes. The way it gets interpreted by a program makes it possible to group the file type. The most common group are text files that represent reasonable text and can be opened by any text editor program.
      The first step in this check routine is to check if the file is readable. Afterwards the guess methods of URLConnection get used to determine the file type. If this is not successful the file extension will be compared with a set of most common text file endings. If none of the listed extension hits the first lines of the file get checked character by character. If the characters are all below 0x7F (which is the common range of valid ASCCI characters for text files), the file gets treated as text. Afterwards a binary check gets passed to include a negative check as well and avoid mistakes. If all these operations fail, an IOException gets thrown.
      Parameters:
      file - the file instance with the full path and name of the file to check.
      Returns:
      true: file is of type text, false: otherwise.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the filed type could not be determined.

    • isHidden

      public static final boolean isHidden​(Path path)
      Checks if a file is hidden. On UNIX operating systems the file is hidden if it starts with dot or slash + dot. On Windows the File.isHidden method gets used.
      Parameters:
      path - path object to check.
      Returns:
      true: file is hidden, false otherwise.

    • getRowsAsString

      public static String getRowsAsString​(File file)
      Read the lines of a ASCII file to a String by using the BufferedReader. This is a very fast type of reading. Especially for large files. Line breaks (\n) are included, too.
      Parameters:
      file - The File instance of the file to work with.
      Returns:
      A list of type String with all lines of the file as elements.

    • getRowsAsString

      public static String getRowsAsString​(String path)
      Read the lines of a ASCII file to a String by using the BufferedReader. This is a very fast type of reading. Especially for large files. Line breaks (\n) are included, too.
      Parameters:
      path - Full name (path + name) of the file to work with.
      Returns:
      A list of type String with all lines of the file as elements.

    • getRowsAsString

      public static String getRowsAsString​(String path, int lineCount)
      Read the lines of a ASCII file to a String by using the BufferedReader. This is a very fast type of reading. Especially for large files. Line breaks (\n) are included, too.
      Parameters:
      path - Full name (path + name) of the file to work with.
      lineCount - Possibility to determine the number of iterations/lines. Use - 1 to switch off.
      Returns:
      A list of type string with all lines of the file as elements.

    • getRowsAsList

      public static List<String> getRowsAsList​(File file)
      Read the lines of a ASCII file to a List by using the BufferedReader. This is a very fast type of reading. Especially for large files.
      Parameters:
      file - The File instance of the file to work with.
      Returns:
      A list of type string with all lines of the file as elements.

    • getRowsAsList

      public static List<String> getRowsAsList​(String path)
      Read the lines of a ASCII file to a List by using the BufferedReader. This is a very fast type of reading. Especially for large files.
      Parameters:
      path - Full name (path + name) of the file to work with.
      Returns:
      A list of type string with all lines of the file as elements.

    • getContent

      public static String getContent​(String path)
      Read the content of a file and close.
      Parameters:
      path - Full name (path + name) of the file to work with.
      Returns:
      The file content as string.

    • getContent

      public static String getContent​(InputStream is)
      Read the content of a InputStream and close.

      Usage: 
       InputStream stream = null;
 try {
   stream = new FileInputStream(path);
 } catch (FileNotFoundException e) {
   e.printStackTrace();
 }
 FileUtil.getContent(stream)
      Parameters:
      is - An input stream for the file to read.
      Returns:
      The file content as string.

    • writeOutputFile

      public static void writeOutputFile​(List<String> list, String fileName)
      Transfers the content of a string list into a defined file. Existing files with the same name will be overwritten.
      Parameters:
      list - Object of type List(String) which content will be written into the output file.
      fileName - Full path and name of the file, where content of the list will be written.
